original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽In conformity with the Dhamma, Triad, Paṭṭhāna text

original: 3.6. Ganthagocchaka, Kusalattika
analyzed: gantha gocchaka kusalattika
translated: The group of connected texts, Triad on the wholesome🔽…

original: 3.6.1.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra
translated: The section on conditions beginning with condition

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The fourfold condition

original: Noganthaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nogantho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nogantham kusalam dhammam paṭicca noganthaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome, unentangled, dhamma is a condition, as a condition by way of conditionality, for a wholesome, unentangled, dhamma. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the root cause, there is one. In the object, there is one. … In the unobscured, there is one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Ganthaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca gantho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Ganthaṁ
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  gantham akusalam dhammam paṭicca ganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā gantha
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)🔽An unwholesome, entangled, dhamma is a condition, as a condition by way of conditionality, for an unwholesome, entangled, dhamma. An unwholesome,

original: akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nogantho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Ganthaṁ akusalaṁ
analyzed: akusalam dhammam paṭicca noganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: entangled, dhamma is a condition, as a condition by way of conditionality, for an unentangled, unwholesome, dhamma. An unwholesome, entangled,

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca gantho akusalo ca nogantho akusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca ganthaḥ akusalaḥ ca noganthaḥ akusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: dhamma is a condition, as a condition by way of conditionality, for an unwholesome, entangled, and an unentangled, unwholesome, dhamma.

original: Noganthaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nogantho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: nogantham akusalam dhammam paṭicca noganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: An unwholesome, unentangled, dhamma is a condition, as a condition by way of conditionality, for an unentangled, unwholesome, dhamma. … there are three.

original: Ganthaṁ akusalañca noganthaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca gantho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantham akusalañca nogantham akusalañca dhammam paṭicca ganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: With a non-knot and an unwholesome state as condition there arises a knot, an unwholesome state. (Abbreviated.)🔽(Nine times.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With a non-cause as condition … (nine times). With a non-decisive-support as condition … (nine times). With a non-pre-nascence as condition … (nine times). With a non-post-nascence as condition … (nine times). With a non-nutritive-essence as condition … (nine times). With a non-kamma as condition … (three times). With a non-result as condition … (nine times). With a non-association as condition … (nine times). (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro api pe sampayutta vāro api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on conascence, etc., should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Gantho akusalo dhammo ganthassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ ganthassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome knot is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome knot. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: (Nine times.) With a cause as condition … (nine times). With an object as condition … (nine times). With a decisive-support as condition … (nine times). With a nutriment as condition … (nine times). With a faculty as condition … (three times). With a jhāna as condition … (nine times). (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With a non-cause as condition … (nine times). With a non-object as condition … (nine times). (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe nava
translated: With a cause as condition, with a non-object as condition … (nine times). (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With no condition being a root, there are nine in object. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Noganthaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nogantho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  nogantham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca noganthaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (Just as in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of working out the permutations in the case of the questions in forward order, in reverse order, in forward and reverse order, and in reverse and forward order should be understood.)🔽With no condition being a root, there are nine in object. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With no condition being a root, there are nine in object. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the case of the questions, too, in each section there is only one permutation series.)

original: 3.6.2. Ganthaniyaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: gantha niyaduka kusalattika
translated: The Permutations in the Triad of the Fetters

original: Hetu🔽Ganthaniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  ganthaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Root Cause🔽With a root cause that is a fetter there is a wholesome consciousness, with one root cause, and with two root causes.🔽With a root cause that is not a fetter there is a wholesome consciousness, with one root cause, and with two root causes. (In brief.)🔽With root cause as condition there are two; with object as condition there are two; … with no condition there are two. (In brief. Like the exposition of the mundane and the supramundane.)🔽… with a root cause that is a fetter there is a wholesome consciousness, with one root cause, and with two root causes.

original: Aganthaniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aganthaniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: aganthaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca aganthaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a root cause that is not a fetter there is a wholesome consciousness, with one root cause, and with two root causes. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ, lokiyalokuttaragamanasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: With root cause as condition there are two; with object as condition there are two; … with no condition there are two. (In brief. Like the exposition of the mundane and the supramundane.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro pi pe pañhā vāro pi vitthāretabbā
translated: (To be elaborated as for the unwholesome.)

original: Ganthaniyaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ganthaniyam akusalam dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: An unwholesome state that is a fetter is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is a fetter. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the root-cause section there is one triad and one dyad. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Ganthaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  ganthaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (In the section on origination through conascence, etc., and in the questions, one should be stated in each case.)🔽A state that is a fetter and is indeterminate is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an indeterminate state that is a fetter.

original: Aganthaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aganthaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: aganthaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca aganthaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: An indeterminate state that is not a fetter is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an indeterminate state that is not a fetter. … three.

original: Ganthaniyaṁ abyākatañca aganthaniyaṁ abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ganthaniyam abyākatam ca a ganthaniyam abyākatam ca dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: An indeterminate state that is a fetter and an indeterminate state that is not a fetter are conditions, as root-cause condition, for an indeterminate state that is a fetter. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ, lokiyalokuttaragamanasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca
translated: In the root-cause section there are five triads and two dyads. (In brief.) (Like the exposition of the mundane and supramundane in the case of the faculties.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro pi pe pañhā vāro pi vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section beginning with “arisen together” should be elaborated in detail.)

original: 3.6.3. Ganthasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika
translated: … Is related to the knots, the wholesome triad, cause.

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause condition

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With wholesome phenomena that are not related to the knots as condition, wholesome phenomena that are not related to the knots arise. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With cause as condition, one … With object as condition, one … With root cause as condition, one … With non-causality as condition, one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Ganthasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Ganthavippayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  gantha sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca gantha sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  gantha vippayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve
translated: (In the section on “arisen together,” etc., and in the section on “questions,” in each case there is one.)🔽With unwholesome phenomena that are related to the knots as condition, unwholesome phenomena that are related to the knots arise. (In brief.)🔽With unwholesome phenomena that are not related to the knots as condition, unwholesome phenomena that are not related to the knots arise. (In brief.)

original: Ganthasampayuttaṁ akusalañca ganthavippayuttaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha sampayuttam akusalañca gantha vippayuttam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca gantha sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With unwholesome phenomena that are related to the knots and unwholesome phenomena that are not related to the knots as condition, unwholesome phenomena that are related to the knots arise. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā cha, napurejāte cha …pe… nakamme cattāri, navippayutte cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate cha saṅkhitta  na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā cha na purejāte cha pe na kamme cattāri na vippayutte cha
translated: As non-condition, one … (In detail as in the previous section.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro pi pe sampayutta vāro pi vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be expanded as in the previous section.)

original: Ganthasampayutto akusalo dhammo ganthasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome state that is connected with the fetters is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is connected with the fetters. (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare samanantare nava, sahajāte cha
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare samanantare nava sahajāte cha
translated: … As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)

analyzed: pe nissaye cha upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme cattāri pe magge cattāri
translated: … As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)

original: sampayutte cha …pe… avigate cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ganthavippayuttaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutte cha pe avigate cha saṅkhitta 🔽gantha vippayuttam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: … As condition, six … (In detail as in the previous section.)🔽… As condition, six

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: … with cause as condition, one … with object as condition, one … with non-hindrance as condition, one. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on origination, etc., and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽3.6.4. Ganthaganthaniyaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  gantha gantha niyaduka kusalattika
translated: … the connected, the unconnected, the profitable triad

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Ganthaniyañceva no ca ganthaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: ganthaniyam ca iva no ca gantham kusalam dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ ca iva no ca ganthaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā eka ārammaṇe eka avigate eka
translated: With a condition that is a root and is connected, but not a tie, a condition arises that is connected, but not a tie, in the way stated. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Ganthañceva ganthaniyañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca gantho ceva ganthaniyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  gantham ca iva ganthaniyam ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca ganthaḥ ca iva ganthaniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … with cause as condition, one … with object as condition, one … with non-hindrance as condition, one.🔽(In the section on origination, etc., and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)🔽With a condition that is a tie and is connected, but not a root, a condition arises that is a tie and is connected, but not a root, in the way stated. (In brief.)

original: Ganthaniyañceva no ca ganthaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: ganthaniyam ca iva no ca gantham akusalam dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ ca iva no ca ganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a condition that is a root and is connected, but not a tie, a condition arises that is a root and is connected, but not a tie, in the way stated. (In brief.)

original: Ganthañceva ganthaniyaṁ akusalañca ganthaniyañceva no ca ganthaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca gantho ceva ganthaniyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantham ca iva ganthaniyam akusalañca ganthaniyam ca iva no ca gantham akusalañca dhammam paṭicca ganthaḥ ca iva ganthaniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: A wholesome root that is a root of dispute and a wholesome root that is a root of entanglement are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a wholesome thought that is a root of entanglement and for a thought that is a root of entanglement and is unwholesome. … (Abbreviated.)🔽(The method of the following triads is the same as that of the preceding triads.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava …pe… nakamme tīṇi …pe… navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Gantho ceva ganthaniyo ca akusalo dhammo ganthassa ceva ganthaniyassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā nava pe na kamme tīṇi pe na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam  ganthaḥ ca iva ganthaniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ ganthassa ca iva ganthaniyassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome thought that is a root of dispute and a wholesome thought that is a root of entanglement are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a thought that is a root of entanglement and is unwholesome. … (Abbreviated.)🔽(The method of treatment in the section on the conascent condition, etc., should be expanded here as in the preceding triads.)🔽A wholesome root that is a root of dispute and a wholesome root that is a root of entanglement are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a thought that is a root of entanglement and is unwholesome. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: (The method of treatment in the section on the conascent condition, etc., should be expanded here as in the preceding triads.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Ganthaniyañceva no ca ganthaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe nava  na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  ganthaniyam ca iva no ca gantham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca ganthaniyaḥ ca iva no ca ganthaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With no cause as condition, nine. (In brief.)🔽With cause as condition, not object, nine. (In brief.)🔽With no cause as condition, object, nine. (In brief.)🔽(As the section on questions in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness should be calculated in forward order, in reverse order, in forward and reverse order, and in reverse and forward order, so should it be calculated here.)🔽With a knot and not a tangle, an unwholesome thought arises, with a knot as condition, not a tangle. (In brief.)🔽

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, nakamme tīṇi …pe… navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta  na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na kamme tīṇi pe na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāro api pe sampayutta vāro api paṭicca vāra sadisā
translated: As non-resolve, nine. (In brief.)🔽(The section on the origin of the unwholesome states that are bound up with the cankers and the unwholesome states that are not bound up with the cankers is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on the origin of the wholesome states that are not bound up with the cankers and the wholesome states that are bound up with the cankers.)

original: Gantho ceva ganthasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo ganthassa ceva ganthasampayuttassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe nava. translated: A state that is a fetter and is also bound up with the fetters is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is a fetter and is also bound up with the fetters. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)

As not a condition for the knowledge of the non-arising of things, nine. As not a condition for the knowledge of the fruit of stream-entry, nine. original: 3.6.6. Ganthavippayuttaganthaniyaduka, Kusalattika
translated: 3.6.6. Unconnected-to-the-hindrances-connected-to-the-hindrances, wholesome triad

original: Hetu🔽Ganthavippayuttaṁ ganthaniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto ganthaniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  gantha vippayuttam ganthaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ ganthaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Cause🔽With a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is unconnected to the hindrances as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is connected to the hindrances arises, by way of cause condition.

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ aganthaniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto aganthaniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam a ganthaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ a ganthaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is unconnected to the hindrances as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is unconnected to the hindrances arises, by way of cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: With cause as condition, two. With object as condition, two. … With non-hindrance as condition, two. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi sabbattha vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro pi pe pañhā vāro pi sabbattha vitthāretabbā
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the section on questions, all should be elaborated in the same way as above.)

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ ganthaniyaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto ganthaniyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam ganthaniyam akusalam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ ganthaniyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome conditioned phenomenon that is unconnected to the hindrances as condition, an unwholesome conditioned phenomenon that is connected to the hindrances arises, by way of cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With cause as condition, one. … With non-hindrance as condition, one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the section on questions, all should be elaborated in the same way as above.)

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ ganthaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto ganthaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam ganthaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ ganthaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā

original: Ganthavippayutto ganthaniyo abyākato dhammo ganthavippayuttassa ganthaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ ganthaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa ganthaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: With a conditionally unwholesome and unprompted state as condition, a conditionally wholesome and unprompted state arises.🔽With a conditionally unwholesome and unprom

original: Ganthavippayutto aganthaniyo abyākato dhammo ganthavippayuttassa aganthaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ aganthaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa aganthaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is unconnected with the knots, not subject to the knots, and indeterminate is a condition, as root-cause condition, for three … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare samanantare cattāri,
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā cattāri anantare samanantare cattāri
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are four. In the section on object, there are three. In the section on predominance, there are four. In the sections on proximity and contiguity, there are four.

original: sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe dve, nissaye satta, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte pañca aññamaññe dve nissaye satta upanissaye cattāri purejāte pacchājāte
translated: In the section on conascence, there are five. In the section on mutuality, there are two. In the section on support, there are seven. In the section on decisive support, there are four. In the sections on before, after, and neither before nor after,

original: dve, āsevane ekaṁ, kamme …pe… magge cattāri, sampayutte dve, vippayutte tīṇi …pe…
analyzed: dve āsevane eka kamme pe magge cattāri sampayutte dve vippayutte tīṇi pe
translated: there are two. In the section on nutriment, there is one. In the sections on faculty, jhāna, and path, there are four. In the section on association, there are two. In the section on dissociation, there are three. …

original: avigate satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: avigate satta saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on nongreed, there are seven. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on non-root-cause, there are seven. In the section on non-object, there are seven. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: In the section on root-cause condition but not as object, there are four. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi 🔽yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: In the section on non-root-cause condition but as object, there are three. (Abbreviated.)🔽As the questions in the exposition by threes were calculated in the case of the profitable triad, so should they be calculated here too.

original: Ganthagocchakakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: gantha gocchaka kusala ttikam
translated: The Chapter on the Skill in the Categories of Knots is finished.
